p: Humanity continues to face a multitude of global socioeconomic challenges due to annual epidemics and punctuated pandemics of highly virulent zoonoses such as avian influenza (H5N1, H7N9) and the 2009 swine flu (H1N1) pandemic [ 1, 2]. The 2009 swine flu (H1N1) pandemic virus involved segments from avian serotype [ 1]. Highly Pathogenic Avian Influenza (HPAI) virus are routinely transmitted to humans in several parts of the world as reported by the World Health Organization (WHO) [ 3] (see figure in supplementary material), including a recent case in Canada [ 4], with an alarming 60% mortality rate [ 5]. Moreover, the disease is of global importance because low pathogenic forms of the viruses cause billions of dollars of annual losses due to recurrent epidemics in poultry [ 5, 6].
